intro: Philotheca brucei subsp. cinerea, commonly known as the grey-leafed philotheca, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, dense hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or heathland environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
